page.title: 11FLETCHING PUBS
page.content: Fletching boast two pubs, Both reflect the present day tread fowards serving food as well as drinks. The Rose & Crown is the older, The building dating from 1550 though records show there has been an inn on this site since 10th century times. A restaurant, opened about 5 years ago, attracts custom from outside the village but it is also used as the "local" for village sports clubs -cricket and football trophie are much in evidence. This latter ensures regular consumption of real ale as opposed to caned beer and lager or wine (on the increase nationally) The Griffin attracts 2 distinctly different clentelle. Local youths play pool and drink at the bar but the Egon Roney recommended restaurant is pationised by the more mature and affluent who come from furter afield.
